Detailed Description

Responsible for playback.

Handles playing and enqueueing track sources, advancing to the next track, logging plays with the server, etc.

For now only track keys are supported, but future versions will accept album and playlist keys or dictionary objects.

To observe track changes, position changes, etc., use KVO. For example: 

  [player addObserver:self forKeyPath:@"currentTrack" options:NSKeyValueObservingOptionNew context:nil];

Member Function Documentation

- (void) next

Advances to the next track in the trackKeys array.

This method only works within the array passed to the playSources: method.

- (void) playSource: (NSString *)  sourceKey

Starts playing a track key, such as "t1232".

Track keys can be found by calling web service API methods. Objects such as Album contain a 'trackKeys' property.

- (void) playSources: (NSArray *)  sourceKeys

Play through a list of track keys, pre-buffering and automatically advancing between songs.

Note: full queue support coming soon.

- (void) previous

Play the previous track in the trackKeys array.

This method only works within a list passed to the playSources: method.

- (void) seekToPosition: (double)  positionInSeconds

Seeks to the given position.

Parameters:
positionInSecondsposition to seek to, in seconds
